titleInfo.title: Easter Parade in downtown Nashville, Tennessee, 1980

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Al Menah Shriners riding on horseback along Church Street during the 1980 Easter Parade in downtown Nashville, Tennessee. Harvey’s Department Store sponsored the parade. This festive springtime parade was enjoyed by many people, with its decorated parade floats, entertainers, and community participation. The event was organized by Kolleen Hudgins, Director of Special Events, under the administration of Mayor Richard Fulton. Forms part of the Kolleen Hudgins, Director of Special Events, Mayor’s Office Collection. 1 color photograph.

titleInfo.title: Kolleen Hudgins, Director of Special Events, Mayor’s Office Collection

subject.topic: Ancient Arabic Order of the Nobles of the Mystic Shrine for North America. Al Menah Temple (Nashville, Tenn.)--History--Sources
